messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin?
The ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin is designed to integrate with GPT4V to automatically annotate images based on the provided API key and URL.
Does the plugin require manual scaling of images?
No, the ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin automatically handles image processing, including scaling, eliminating the need for manual intervention.
How can I use GPT4V for image annotation with this plugin?
To use GPT4V for image annotation, you need to provide your API key and API URL within the plugin settings.
What role does the seed value play in the labeling process?

The seed value in the ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin ensures the consistency of the labeling process. If the seed value remains unchanged for the same image, the plugin will not make additional calls to OpenAI for labeling.
Can I modify the seed value if I'm not satisfied with the labeling results?
Yes, you can modify the seed value in the ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin to obtain different outputs if you are not satisfied with the initial labeling.
What are the available prompt types in this plugin?

The ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin offers two prompt types: 'generic' and 'figure'. The 'figure' type focuses only on the overall characteristics of the characters and excludes color terms, backgrounds, watermarks, signatures, etc.
Is there an option to enable weighted labels in this plugin?
Yes, the ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin allows you to enable weights for labels. When enabled, corresponding weight values will be assigned to the labels.
How can I exclude specific words from the generated labels?
You can exclude specific words from the generated labels in the ComfyUI-GPT4V-Image-Captioner plugin by entering them in the 'exclude_words' field, and the system will automatically remove them.
